Message: The user completes the submission of the form
Hi there! How can I assist you today?

There could be a few reasons why your campaigns aren't spending. One common issue is the launch date at the ad set level. Since Ad Manager is in PST/military time, some advertisers don't realize their campaign is set to start at a later time. You might want to check the launch date and time settings for your campaign.

If the launch date is fine, there might be other factors affecting your campaign spending. Here are a few things you can check:
1. **Budget and Bidding Strategy**: Ensure your budget and bidding strategy are set appropriately for your target audience.
2. **Targeting**: Review your audience targeting to make sure it's not too narrow.
3. **Ad Creative**: Make sure your ad creative is engaging and relevant to your audience.
4. **Ad Scheduling**: Consider scheduling your ads to run during peak hours when your target audience is most active.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our Reporting Guide here: [Reporting Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18088532505485-Reporting-Guide).
its literally broad, its been days, and the campaigns has only spent 100

I understand your frustration. Here are a few additional steps you can take to troubleshoot the issue:
1. **Increase Budget Gradually**: During the learning phase, it's recommended not to make too many changes. Try increasing your budget by no more than 50% every 2-3 days.
2. **Ad Set Creation**: Create 2-3 ad sets and once the cold start is complete, keep the higher performing set and switch off the others.
3. **Review Ad Performance**: Regularly review your ad performance in the Reporting tab and make adjustments to improve results.
4. **Experiment with Creatives**: Experiment with different types of assets, such as videos and images, to see which performs best.
For more detailed best practices, you can refer to our tCPA Best Practices guide here: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
I am using max conversion with no targweting at all and it wont even spent the daily budget

Got it. If you're using Max Conversion with no targeting and it's still not spending the daily budget, here are a few things you can try:
1. **Increase Daily Budget**: Sometimes, starting with a higher daily budget can help the system gather data more quickly. Try increasing your daily budget gradually.
2. **Check Learning Phase**: Ensure that your campaign has passed the learning phase. It typically takes about 20-30 conversions to get through this phase.
3. **Review Ad Creative**: Make sure your ad creative is engaging and relevant to your audience.
4. **Monitor Performance**: Keep an eye on performance metrics and make adjustments as needed.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our Maximize Conversions Best Practices guide here: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
there has been no conversions because it barely spent anything

I understand the challenge you're facing. Here are a few additional steps you can take to help your campaign spend its budget and start generating conversions:
1. **Increase Initial Budget**: Start with a higher initial daily budget to give the system more data to work with. This can help it optimize more effectively.
2. **Ad Creative Variations**: Test different ad creatives to see if certain types perform better and attract more engagement.
3. **Monitor and Adjust**: Regularly monitor your campaign's performance and make small adjustments as needed.
4. **Relaunch Campaign**: If the current campaign is not performing, consider relaunching it with fresh creatives and a higher initial budget.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our Maximize Conversions guide here: [Maximize Conversions Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20624355375117-Introduction-to-Maximize-Conversions).
Hi there! How can I assist you today?
can i change the default time zone of my account

Currently, the default time zone for NewsBreak Ad Manager is set to PST (Pacific Standard Time) and cannot be changed. If you need to adjust your campaign settings according to your local time zone, you will need to manually convert the times. For more details on managing your account, you can refer to our Account Management Guide here: [Account Management Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide).
